channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump tempts fate with warnings ahead of rally
item.description: President Donald Trump returns to the campaign trail Saturday in Tulsa with his first rally since the coronavirus pandemic began, looking to reignite support for his struggling reelection bid while sweeping aside concerns from his own health experts and continuing to stoke tensions by threatening protesters outside his Oklahoma spectacle.

item.title: Powerful US attorney who investigated Trump associates refuses to step down
item.description: Geoffrey Berman, the powerful US attorney for the Southern District of New York who has investigated a number of powerful associates with connections to President Donald Trump, was forced out of his position Friday, two sources tell CNN.

item.title: How Trump plans to turn around his losing campaign
Every room in this hotel is booked. But the guests are not allowed to leave
item.description: Every day, the men unfurl large pleas for help over the balcony railings of their hotel room and stand in silence as traffic roars along the main road of the Australian city they're trapped in.

item.title: Are China and India on the brink of war?
Brazil tops 1 million Covid-19 cases, Australian state of Victoria reimposes restrictions
What happened on Santorini when the tourism 'machine' stopped
item.description: There's a reason Greece's Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis flew to Santorini earlier this month when he wanted to announce the reopening of his country to tourism.

item.title: Tens of thousands of Britons have died from coronavirus. But Boris Johnson is stoking a culture war.
item.description: Britain is in the middle of a coronavirus disaster. It has one of the highest fatality rates in the world, with at least 52,000 Britons dead from the disease. The UK government's usual cheerleaders in the right-wing media are eviscerating it on a near-daily basis.

item.title: UK police probed after Black man shouts 'I can't breathe' during arrest
The fashion industry says it stands against racism. Critics aren't buying it
item.description: Since May 26, headlines have been dominated by the killing of George Floyd and the international protests it has ignited. Thousands have taken to the streets around the world to denounce police brutality and anti-blackness, while online, thousands more have posted en masse in support of #BlackLivesMatter (BLM) and called for an end to systemic racism.

item.title: Amid nationwide rallies and celebrations, more cities, states and universities designate Juneteenth as an official holiday
item.description: Rallies, peaceful marches and celebrations commemorating Juneteenth occurred across the United States on Friday, bringing together countless Americans in remembrance as the nation confronts a history saturated with systemic racism and injustice.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
This drug may be the secret behind Portugal's low Covid-19 death rate
item.description: Portugal has been one of the most successful European countries at beating back Covid-19, despite also being one of the poorest. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports on the small Iberian country's response to Covid-19.

item.title: Sporting legend Alex Zanardi in artificial coma after horrific handbike crash in Italy
item.description: Ex-Formula One driver and four-time Paralympic gold medalist Alex Zanardi is in an artificial coma after suffering severe head injuries in a horrific cycling race crash.

item.title: Twitter permanently suspends account of Katie Hopkins
item.description: Twitter has permanently suspended the account of extreme right-wing British columnist Katie Hopkins for violating its hateful conduct policy.

item.title: Illegal raves are booming in lockdown Britain. Can authorities stop a third Summer of Love?
item.description: After three months of confinement, the footage seemed otherworldly: bucket hats, balloons, a heavy techno beat, and a few thousand young people crammed into a small clearing in the woods.

item.title: What's been happening in China's Xinjiang, home to 11 million Uyghurs?
item.description: As US President Donald Trump signed a bill into law Wednesday that aims to punish Beijing for its repression of the Uyghur ethnic minority, he was accused by his former national security adviser of endorsing China's construction of internment camps in its western region of Xinjiang.

item.title: US golfer becomes first player on PGA Tour to test positive for Covid-19
item.description: American golfer Nick Watney is the first player on the PGA Tour to test positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Kim Jong Un's sister takes center stage amid chaos in the Koreas
item.description: On a crisp winter day two years ago, Kim Yo Jong took her first step to becoming the powerful politician her father thought she would be.

item.title: Parent of toddler in 'manipulated' Trump video forces Facebook and Twitter to remove it
item.description: Facebook on Friday removed a video posted by President Donald Trump's account that had twisted a viral video of two toddlers after one of the children's parents lodged a copyright claim. The video had more than 4 million views by the time Facebook took it down.

item.title: 16-year-old boy attacked by a shark in North Carolina
item.description: A 16-year-old boy visiting North Carolina's Outer Banks with his family is recovering from injuries suffered when he was attacked by a shark on Thursday.

item.title: South Africa has the continent's highest Covid-19 cases. Now, it faces another pandemic.
'Healthy' teenager who took precautions died suddenly of Covid-19
item.description: It started as a normal day. Dawn Guest, 54, got up and headed out to her job as a nurse around 5 a.m. She heard her 16-year-old son, Andre, stirring in his room, but he had always been an earlier riser, even when his school was shut for Covid-19. Later that day she would get a call from her husband, telling her there was something wrong with their son.

item.title: Tech CEO quits after $2 billion goes missing and fraud accusations fly
item.description: More than $2 billion has gone missing at one of Europe's most vaunted tech companies. If it's not found quickly, the digital payments firm may never recover.

item.title: Ian Holm, 'Lord of the Rings' star, dead at 88
item.description: British actor Ian Holm has died at the age of 88, according to a statement from his agent.

item.title: Acosta to McEnany: Doesn't sharing fake videos make you fake news?
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta presses White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany about a video posted by President Donald Trump on Twitter, which the social media site has since labeled "manipulated media."

item.title: Summer solstice 2020: Sensual traditions on the longest day of the year
item.description: Call it love. Call it romance. Call it sensuality. Go ahead and call it old-fashioned lust if you want.

item.title: CNN reporter explains how to know the truth about what's going on in North Korea
item.description: Clues can be the only way to work out what's really going on in North Korea. CNN's Will Ripley shares which ones to look out for.

item.title: Officer accused of killing Rayshard Brooks is moved from a jail over security concerns
item.description: The officer accused of killing Rayshard Brooks was moved from a jail to a different facility in Atlanta over security concerns hours before he appears in court Friday.

item.title: China responds to bombshells in Bolton's book
item.description: A Chinese spokesman responded to explosive claims made in former national security adviser John Bolton's book that President Donald Trump asked China for help to get him reelected. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: Colgate is still selling 'Black Person Toothpaste' in China. Now that's under review
item.description: Colgate has announced a review of its toothpaste brand Darlie, which once featured a smiling White man in blackface, as companies around the world reconsider their use of racist stereotypes following the killing of George Floyd.

item.title: See what Tulsa's Black Wall Street has become
item.description: 99 years ago, Black Wall Street in Tulsa's Greenwood neighborhood was burned down in a historic race riot. CNN's Abby Phillip visits the site and talks to descendants of survivors of the attack.

item.title: Could this invisible air shield protect fliers from Covid-19?
A Martian city for the desert outside Dubai
item.description: Dubai is a city where firefighters use jetpacks, archipelagos are built from scratch, and buildings climb into the clouds; a slick metropolis in the middle of a vast red desert. First-time visitors would be forgiven for thinking they had stumbled onto a film set for a sci-fi movie.

item.title: Italian village underwater since 1994 could resurface
item.description: A 12th century Italian village submerged underwater for more than 25 years could soon see the light of day again.

item.title: First hypercar factory in the Middle East set to open
item.description: In 2015, W Motors achieved global prominence when cinema audiences watched Vin Diesel drive a cherry-red sports car through the windows of a skyscraper in the seventh installment of "The Fast Saga."

item.title: Jamie Foxx shows off bulked-up physique as he prepares for Mike Tyson biopic
item.description: Oscar-winning actor Jamie Foxx has confirmed that he will play Mike Tyson in an upcoming biopic about the life of the American former heavyweight boxer.

item.title: Apple is closing some of the stores it reopened because of a spike in coronavirus cases
item.description: Apple reopened dozens of stores across the United States last month, after shutting them because of the coronavirus. Now, it is closing some of them again.

item.title: The extreme hotel hygiene awaiting tourists in Spain
item.description: It's breakfast time, which means I need to get my temperature checked, put on my face mask, smother my hands in alcohol disinfectant and wear a pair of plastic gloves.

item.title: Same-sex couples in Singapore pose in front of traditional marriage portraits
item.description: In the intimate seclusion of a studio space, two women sit, arms linked around one another. Illuminated by the pink glow of a projected photograph of a married couple on their wedding day, the two women wear black and white; one of them loosely holds a bouquet.

item.title: British forces' 'sweetheart' and singer Vera Lynn has died
item.description: Dame Vera Lynn, whose sentimental ballads during World War II provided the soundtrack for the Allied war effort, has died at the age of 103, according to a statement from the Dame Vera Lynn Children's Charity.

item.title: This entry-level Lamborghini offers more fun for a lot less money
item.description: Lamborghini's new Huracn Evo RWD is the Italian auto maker's least expensive supercar -- and it is also the most enjoyable one to drive.

item.title: NYC diner's drive-in becomes hot ticket during coronavirus
item.description: One New York City diner is turning their parking lot into a venue for drive-in movies and stand up comedy shows during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Bill Weir reports.

item.title: 'Good for him': Preet Bharara on US attorney's refusal to leave
item.description: Geoffrey Berman, the powerful US attorney for the Southern District of New York who has investigated a number of powerful associates with connections to President Donald Trump, was forced out of his position, two sources tell CNN. Berman later issued a statement refusing to step aside. CNN's Evan Prez and former US attorney Preet Bharara discuss the news.

item.title: They voted for Trump. Here's what they think now
item.description: In the wake of Donald Trump's surprise election win in 2016, CNN's Van Jones went on a journey of discovery across America to understand why voters sent Trump to Washington.

item.title: Trying to predict Biden's veep? The conventional wisdom is usually wrong
item.description: The veepstakes is kicking into high gear for former Vice President Joe Biden.

item.title: The past catches up to Trump
item.description: Whether it was via legal arguments or exchanges published in a controversial tell-all by a former administration member, President Donald Trump had to contend with his past amid ongoing, very current, issues this week.

item.title: Legal analyst equates firing to a 'Friday Night Massacre'
item.description: Geoffrey Berman, the powerful US attorney for the Southern District of New York who has investigated a number of associates with ties to President Donald Trump, said he will not leave his post shortly after the Department of Justice announced he was stepping down. CNN senior legal analyst Laura Coates talks about what the move says about Attorney General William Barr.

item.title: The disputed border that pushed India and China to the edge
Pence refuses to say 'Black lives matter'
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence declined to say the words "Black lives matter" during an interview with an ABC affiliate in Pennsylvania on Friday, instead saying that "all lives matter."
